messageBody:
> I'm sure this topic must have been discussed before but I'd
> really appreciate your comments, or more, your personal
> experience concerning your test package structure. The two
> alternatives that I see are:
>
> 1)
> src/com.mycompany.myapp.MyClass src/test.mycompany.myapp.MyClassTest
>
> 2)
> src/java/com.mycompany.myapp.MyClass
> src/test/com.mycompany.myapp.MyClassTest
>
> The first one separates the packages so that the deployment
> is easier however there's need to import the tested classes
> within the test cases. The second one removes the problem of
> importing however, for anybody external to the application,
> the test cases suddenly make part of the final product.

Something like #1 is often used to ensure that unit tests have access only
to the public members of the classes under test. I suppose it would also be
easy to separate test and production code when packaging for a release, but
I've used choice #2 for that. Now, there's no harm in shipping tests with
production code. End users, especially if they're using your "product" to
create one of their own, may appreciate very much that you include tests;
please consider it.

Craig Demyanovich
